availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Aulsebrook (Louisville, Kentucky, painter and private (U.S.A.))

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Aulsebrook. Student in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Painter in Louisville in 1860. Served in the Frankfort Battalion of the Capital Guard Regiment (U.S.A.) as private on February 2, 1865. Transferred to 55th Kentucky Mounted Infantry (U.S.A.) as private in March 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 2, p.148A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, 7th Ward, p.414.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 823.
KYR-0003-101-0013.
